## **<i class="fas fa-user-circle"></i> Who I Am**

::: {.profile-card data-aos="fade-up"}
I am a **Research Data Manager and Data Scientist** specializing in **Health Financial Diaries, Data Analysis, Machine Learning, and Outcomes & Impact Evaluation**. With **8+ years of progressive experience**, I conduct research on the **livelihood and financial behavior of low-income households**, combining expertise in **health economics** with advanced data science to drive evidence-based decision-making for multi-million dollar international projects.

My career combines **end-to-end data management**, **advanced statistical analysis**, **rigorous M&E frameworks**, **field operations leadership**, and **capacity building**. Currently with **Georgetown University gui2de** conducting RCTs and impact evaluations, I specialize in transforming complex data into actionable insights that drive program success and policy change.

**What makes me different:** I've led the complete project lifecycle‚Äîfrom designing M&E frameworks and training field teams of 50+ enumerators, to conducting high-frequency checks (HFCs) in R & Stata, to delivering compelling donor reports. With **Washington University M&E Certification** (2025) and 3 published papers, I bring both academic rigor and practical field experience.
:::

## **<i class="fas fa-microscope"></i> Current Focus**

::: {.focus-section data-aos="fade-up"}
### <i class="fas fa-graduation-cap"></i> MSc Thesis Research

I'm currently completing my **MSc in Epidemiology and Biostatistics** at JOOUST, with my thesis examining:

**"Exploring Financial Determinants of Effective Hypertension and Diabetes Management in Primary Health Facilities in Kisumu County"**

This research investigates the critical intersection of health facility financing and NCD management outcomes, employing:

- <i class="fas fa-flask"></i> Mixed-methods case study design
- <i class="fas fa-hospital"></i> Financial assessments of 30+ health facilities
- <i class="fas fa-user-friends"></i> Patient outcome tracking (500+ participants)
- <i class="fas fa-calculator"></i> Cost-effectiveness analysis
- <i class="fas fa-chart-bar"></i> Interactive dashboards for real-time monitoring

[<i class="fas fa-arrow-right"></i> View Thesis Project ‚Üí](../research/thesis.qmd){.cta-button style="margin-top: 1rem;"}
:::

## **<i class="fas fa-university"></i> Open Governance & Civic Tech** {#governance}

::: {.governance-section data-aos="fade-up"}
### <i class="fas fa-balance-scale"></i> A Passion for People-Centric Governance

My commitment to **open governance** and **digital civic tools** was born during my time as a junior officer with **Homa Bay County Government**. This experience opened my eyes to both the potential and challenges of public service.

**What I learned:**

- <i class="fas fa-eye"></i> Citizens need transparent access to government data and decision-making processes
- <i class="fas fa-users"></i> Digital tools can bridge the gap between government and citizens
- <i class="fas fa-gavel"></i> Accountability mechanisms are essential for trust in public institutions
- <i class="fas fa-hand-holding-heart"></i> Governments should be designed around people's needs, not bureaucratic convenience

**Why I left public service:**

While I deeply valued the opportunity to serve, I realized I wasn't in a position to make the transformative changes I envisioned. The constraints of the system limited my ability to build the digital civic tools and transparency mechanisms I believed were necessary.

**My ongoing commitment:**

I continue to work on tools and projects that advance open governance and civic engagement. My goal is to one day contribute to policies and platforms that:

- <i class="fas fa-unlock"></i> Make government data more accessible and understandable
- <i class="fas fa-bullhorn"></i> Enable citizens to participate meaningfully in governance
- <i class="fas fa-shield-alt"></i> Create accountability systems that hold leaders responsible
- <i class="fas fa-heart"></i> Transform governments to be truly people-centric

::: {.highlight-box style="margin-top: 2rem;"}
**<i class="fas fa-quote-left"></i>** I hope to one day make a meaningful mark in policies that transform how governments serve their people, making transparency and accountability the norm rather than the exception. **<i class="fas fa-quote-right"></i>**

Even outside formal public service, I remain committed to using my data science and technology skills to advance democratic participation and government transparency.
:::
:::
